intro: Blepharodon rahmeri, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with fine hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in spikes, typically blooming in the spring. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
